    demo

    demo.Rmd
    #remotes::install_github("PengSU517/robcovsel")
#remotes::install_github("PengSU517/shootings") !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
#This shootings package is not my original work. The functions in this package were forked from https://github.com/ineswilms/sparse-shooting-S. I constructed a package of those functions to make them more convenient to use.
library(robcovsel)
library(shootings)

    Data generation

    gen = genevar(p = 10, e = 0.1)
x = gen$x
y = gen$y

    test

    system.time({fit1 = covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "pair",scale.method = "qn")})  #ALRP
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.05    0.01    0.07
system.time({fit2 = covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "gaussrank",scale.method = "qn")})#ALGR
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.01    0.00    0.01
system.time({fit3 = sparseshooting(x,y)})#sparse shooting S
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    3.93    0.10    4.04

summary(lm(y~x))
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = y ~ x)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -13.4120  -2.1355  -0.0745   2.6851   9.3380 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)

lm(y~x)$coe[-1]
#>           x1           x2           x3           x4           x5           x6 
#>  0.001874802  0.144389352  0.280272182  0.345302696  0.015218948  0.123071205 
#>           x7           x8           x9          x10 
#>  0.256944344 -0.175958000 -0.129883185 -0.076776803
cov(y)-t(cov(x,y))%*%MASS::ginv(cov(x))%*%cov(x,y)
#>          [,1]
#> [1,] 15.19068
tail(covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "pearson",scale.method = "sd", pda.method = F)$betahat,1)
